exam_papers.title: 2024年12月大学英语六级考试真题（二）
exam_papers.description: 2024年12月大学英语六级考试真题（第二套），包含写作、听力、阅读理解和翻译四个部分

exam_sections.directions: For this part you are allowed 30 minutes to write an essay that begins with the sentence "Nowadays, more and more students have realized the importance of self-discipline in their personal growth." You can make comments, cite examples or use your personal experiences to develop your essay. You should write at least 150 words but no more than 200 words. You should copy the sentence given in quotes at the beginning of your essay.
exam_sections.passage_title: The Importance of Self-discipline in Personal Growth

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear two passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear three recordings of lectures or talks followed by three or four questions. The recordings will be played only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage. Read the passage through carefully before making your choices. Each choice in the bank is identified by a letter. Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre. You may not use any of the words in the bank more than once.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Ever been talking about something important with someone you care about and found the discussion frustrating instead of fruitful? Negative energy can then cast a ___26___ over your efforts to build a shared understanding.

In fact, collaborative problem-solving conversations require skills. Strong listening skills are essential. Sprinkling in positivity via appreciation, ___27___ smiles, and warm comments helps. So does the essential ability to keep your emotional tone in the calm zone. If the tone of a dialogue heats up and anger erupts, the dialogue ___28___ from collaborative to adversarial, and progress is likely to come to an immediate ___29___.

In addition, effective dialogue generally has another important characteristic: symmetry.

Symmetry in dialogue refers to the balance of how much each partner talks. Are you each getting equal airtime? When one participant does most of the talking, this asymmetry or lack of balance tends to become annoying to one or both of you. The silent partner ___30___ tires of only listening, while the talker can feel ___31___ Usually, both would prefer more equal give and take.

Different rates of speech and levels of voice volume can ___32___ symmetry as well. The faster or louder partner can easily begin taking up more airtime. The slower-talking or softer-voiced one can have trouble getting the floor.

Conversations also lose balance when one partner's opinions count more than the other's. One person's input may carry more sway because their style of expression is more ___33___ . One viewpoint may tend to get lost because it is expressed more ___34___ .

If either partner fairly consistently ___35___ or evaporates, modifying the pattern will be helpful. The dialogue will feel more productive, and at the same time, the relationship overall is likely to feel more positive.

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived. You may choose a paragraph more than once. Each paragraph is marked with a letter. Answer the questions by marking the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.passage_content:
A) Blue moons, rose moons, supermoons. For some reason all the websites seem to think you really want to know all about these moons. "Catch This Weekend's AMAZING SUPERMOON", one headline will announce. "The Supermoon Isn't Actually A Big Deal And You're All Ruining Astronomy", another will complain.

B) The latest example is the super blood wolf moon eclipse which sounds like the name of an emotional song I would have performed a modern dance routine to in 9th grade, but is, in fact, an astronomical event set to occur on January 20. As we'll explain below, there is nothing truly mysterious or otherwise special about this moon, and it will not look like a bloody wolf head in the sky or anything wild like that. We get these super lunar events by smashing together all the qualifiers we've historically used to keep track of full moons throughout the year, and in the age of the internet we can get a little too enthusiastic.

C) Consider this your go-to resource for all moon-gazing news. Here's what you need to know about the latest lunar event.

D) Look, it's okay if you don't know. There are probably loads of folks who walk around pretending they totally know why that thing in the sky seems to get bigger and smaller at regular intervals but who totally do not.

E) The moon orbits Earth, and it's tidally locked --- that means it always shows us the same face, instead of spinning around like our planet does. That's why you can always see the man on the moon (or the moon rabbit, depending on your cultural preferences) even as it spins around us. But while the moon is big and bright in the sky when it's full, that's only because it's reflecting light from the sun. But the moon is always moving. so it's getting hit with sunlight at different angles. It's invisible to us during the new moon, because our satellite is parked right between us and the sun; the so-called dark side of the moon is lit up like Las Vegas, but the side we can see is in shadow. A full moon happens when the earth is right between the sun and the moon, so sunlight hits the part we can see. And all the other phases are just the transition from one of those extremes to the other.

F) The moon isn't always exactly the same distance from Earth, because its orbit isn't perfectly circular. We call the closest point perigee (近地点), and the most distant point is apogee (远地点). 2018's closest perigee and most distant apogee both happened in January, and the difference was about 30,000 miles.

G) The reason you care about this ordinary change in distance is that it turns a moon super. When a full moon happens close to perigee. it's going to look a bit bigger. Honestly, the difference is not that profound, but if you're in a position to photograph the supermoon next to something that shows the slight increase in scale, it can look pretty cool, January's super blood wolf moon eclipse is super because the date lines up with the closest the moon will get to us during January,but the moon won't actually be at its closest for the year until February's supermoon, which you can expect plenty of undue excitement over.

H) Blood moons only occur during total lunar eclipses (which can happen a few times a year in any given location). When the moon slips through our shadow, we give it a reddish coloring. The moon can also look orange whenever it's rising or setting, or if it hangs low in the horizon all night --- the light bouncing off of it has to travel through a thicker atmosphere there, which scatters more blue light away. But you'll probably only see that deep, sinister red during an eclipse.

I) A lot of headlines about moons are just ridiculous (you do not need to be particularly excited about a blue moon. it just looks like a regular full moon), but you should definitely roll out of bed to look at a blood moon if one is going to be visible in your region, even though they're just lunar eclipses and not evidence of bloody battles between the sky gods.

J) In March of 2018, we had our second "blue moon" of the year, to much acclaim. And while that's not necessarily special in an oh-gosh-get-out-and-look-at-it way, it's certainly special: a blue moon is a nickname for when two full moons fall in the same calendar month, and we hadn't previously had two in one year since 1999. We won't have it happen again until 2037. Astronomer David Chapman explained that this is merely a peculiarity of our calendar; once we stopped doing things based on the moon and started trying to follow the sun and the seasons, we stopped having one reliable full moon per month. The moon cycle is 29.53 days long on average, so in most months we still end up with a single new moon and a single full one. But every once in a while, one month steals a full moon from another. In 2018 (and in 1999, and again in 2037) both January and March had a full moon on both the first and last nights of the month, leaving February "in the dark".

K) Getting two blue moons a year is rare, but we have individual blue moons every few years. Also, fun fact: not actually blue. A moon can indeed take on a moody blue color, but this only happens when particles of just the right size disperse through the sky — and it has nothing to do with the moon's status as "blue". Big clouds of ash from volcanic eruptions or fires can do the trick, but it doesn't happen often, and the stars would certainly have to align for two such rare instances to occur at once.

L) You may have heard that the super special second blue moon of 2018 was also a Paschal moon. This is true! That just means it was the first full moon of spring, which is often used to determine the date of Easter Sunday. All of this is just calendar nonsense and we refuse to go into it further.

M) Sometimes you'll see a headline that promises a moon with so many qualifiers it makes your head spin. A super blue blood worm moon, perhaps? Or a super blood wolf moon? Lots of websites will tell you that "wolf moon" is the traditional name of the first full moon of the year in "Native American" cultures, which is kind of a weird thing to claim given that there are 573 registered Tribal Nations in the US alone today, not to mention historically. The idea that hungry, howling wolves were such a universal constant in January that all of North America with its different cultures, geographies, and languages spontaneously came up with the same nickname is illogical.

N) Many cultures have traditional names for the full moon in a given month or season, so there's quite a list to draw from if you're trying to really juice up a story on a slightly-bigger-than-average view of the moon. But these are all based on human calendars and activities and folklore; you will not go outside and see a pink moon in April, though I wish it were so.
exam_sections.passage_title: What Is a Super Blood Wolf Moon?

exam_sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C) and D). You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Passage One

With population increases and global urbanisation ever accelerating, much attention is focused on the sustainability of our cities and scarce attention is paid to the countryside.

Rural life is associated with closely-knit communities, sense of belonging, and a simple. tranquil life. Yet whilst some or all of these elements exist in the countryside, so do conservatism and a lack of employment opportunities. And it is mostly due to the latter that rural communities are suffering. Attracted by the improved economics of urban areas, country-dwellers across the world are moving out, contributing to the excessive crowdedness of densely populated cities, and leaving the countryside in desolation.

So how can the countryside ensure its survival among these changes; or should it at all? Due to both the distance between residences and facilities and often intermittent public transport, those living in the countryside are heavier automobile users. Rural dwellers also use more energy maintaining their mostly detached buildings. We may be piled up like boxes in the city, but this brings energy efficiency that the countryside cannot match. Rural energy requirements result in higher carbon emissions per person than in the city, so it is actually irresponsible to endorse such a lifestyle choice.

Protecting the countryside is a hot topic. Those who have made their fortunes in the city often buy second homes in the countryside, visiting intermittently for a sample of a supposedly simple life. The side-effect of this is that house prices are pushed up due to increased demand, leaving them unaffordable for local people. A solution has yet to be found for this challenge, for market forces are further forcing residents out of the countryside. For those who believe in rural preservation, this is deplorable.

Whilst an idealised view of the countryside is common, the reality is that rural life has continuously evolved. Industrialisation brought an increase in divisions of labour, changing social links between rural people. The internet has introduced once foreign cultures into the countryside. Improved travel connections and affordability have made the world more accessible, creating a "global village". Considering these changes, surely an evolving countryside is inevitable.

Perhaps the countryside should also prepare itself for massive population increases in the future. With cities across the world growing rapidly, how will the current urban generation respond to the inevitable social changes of mass urbanization? Will the longing for a simpler life become stronger, fueling a rural renaissance?

As the world continues to urbanise, the voices calling for rural preservation may well grow louder. But change is inevitable, we know that the world is going to see new cities emerging from the dust and current cities growing into megacities, but the future of the countryside is less clear.

Passage Two

Statements, like "beauty is in the eye of the beholder (观看者)", are rarely questioned. They've become so embedded in our consciousness that people think it's absurd to think otherwise. It might be useful, however, to at least push back on this assumption because people evaluate environment, situations, and people aesthetically. We may find that we still believe it is correct, but we may also find that there is a lot more to the situation than you suppose.

A recent study exploring aesthetic taste was published in Cognition. The results from this study show that people agree very much in their aesthetic evaluation of natural objects, but they disagree more about artifacts, or human-made objects.

The study found that shared taste was most common for faces and natural landscapes, but least common among works of architecture and art. The hypothesis is the commonly pleasing features, like proportion or symmetry, are at work.

Preferences for natural scenes might be learned through life experiences. Factors like habitability, safety, and openness might be preferred as people develop. Some of the details of landscapes change, but the basics are more common, e.g., water, open spaces, and signs of care.

Art and architecture, unlike natural spaces, do not have the same level of exposure. So, people do not have the same level of shared taste.

It's possible that the lower amount of agreement in the shared taste of artifacts has to do more with elements of style, rather than "behavioral consequences".

All of the consequences seem reasonable (or at least possible), but I think there might be an interesting philosophical conclusion that they did not draw. It seems that there is an objective ground to our aesthetic preferences or evaluations. I am not saying this would mean beauty is completely objective, just that there could possibly be general objective principles at work, i.e., beauty is not simply in the eye of the beholder.

Nature exhibits some of the universal aesthetic features such as radiance in a common way throughout the world. It's not exactly the same everywhere, but it is common. For example, a sunset is similar enough in different places to warrant almost universal appeal.

Possible universal principles of beauty — such as proportion, fittingness, radiance, and others — are general categories, which allow for a wide array of embodiments. When people get involved in making artifacts in architecture or art, they apply these very general concepts in unique ways. But the way they applied the principle may not have universal appeal.

This is why it's important to experience diverse cultures and their artifacts because it opens us up to different ways of approaching or constructing beauty. And it is always good to question our assumptions.

exam_sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.translation_content: 洋山港(Yangshan Port)是上海航运中心的重要组成部分,是中国第一个深水港,也是世界上规模最大的深水港之一。经过近20年的发展,洋山港已实现高度自动化。数字技术和人工智能的使用大大减少了用工成本和碳排放。自主研发的码头管理系统可以在百公里之外对大型设备进行远程操控。洋山港看上去一片繁忙,现场却见不到人工操作,而且能够24小时不间断运作。洋山港将不断发展,为把上海建成一个全球航运中心做出更大贡献。
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write an essay that begins with the sentence "Nowadays, more and more students have realized the importance of self-discipline in their personal growth."
exam_questions.analysis: 写作题目，需要学生以给定句子开头写一篇关于自律重要性的议论文
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的议论文写作能力，包括论点阐述、论证支持和结论总结

exam_questions.question_text: What did the man want to discuss with the woman?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Changing his major.", "B) His family situation.", "C) Revising his graduation thesis.", "D) His passion for Art History."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。当女士问男士他想讨论什么事情时，男士说关于自己的专业，他改变了主意。也就是说，他有转换专业的想法，想与女士就此进行讨论。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话开头男士提到：'I'm having second thoughts about my major.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does the man want to give up Art History?
exam_questions.options: ["A) He doesn't think it legitimate to depend on his father.", "B) He thinks his financial situation has now changed.", "C) He doesn't think it will provide him with a living.", "D) He thinks it nourishes the financially secure only."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。女士问男士为什么要放弃艺术史的学习，男士回答说他父亲目前的经济状况让他意识到，更能解决经济问题的就业机会也许不是一件坏事，并说艺术史滋养了他的灵魂，却并不能为他提供餐桌上的食物。
exam_questions.explanation: 男士提到：'Art History nourishes my soul, but does nothing to put food on my plate.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman advise the man to do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Try his best to socialize and build a network in the art industry.", "B) Seek financially viable employment opportunities after graduation.", "C) Investigate all possible ways to become a celebrity in the art world.", "D) Strike a balance between intellectual pursuits and financial security."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。女士对男士说，如果他一心想在艺术行业工作，就需要更加坚定自信，并且要开始与人交谈。如果想成为博物馆和画廊界的名人，建立人脉非常关键。
exam_questions.explanation: 女士建议：'if your heart is set on working in the art industry, you need to be more assertive and start talking with people. Networking is key...'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man say he really lacks right now?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Money.", "B) Time.", "C) Determination.", "D) Optimism."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。男士说现在时间非常宝贵，他没有社交生活，并提到他快跟不上学习进度了，而且今年年底就要交论文。
exam_questions.explanation: 男士提到：'Time is a very precious commodity right now. My social life does not exist. I can barely keep up with my studies...'

exam_questions.question_text: What are the speakers mainly talking about in the conversation?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Their decision on investigating beef consumption.", "B) Their original ideas about the domestic market.", "C) Their different approaches to a case study.", "D) Their end-of-semester business projects."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话开头，男士就询问女士期末的商业项目是否已经确定了。接下来，他们分别描述了自己的期末商业项目，并对对方的项目发表了看法。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话开头：'Have you decided yet what your end-of-semester business project will be on?'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man say makes perfect sense?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Expanding farmland out west.", "B) Importing most of the beef.", "C) Raising cattle domestically.", "D) Continuing to boost economic growth."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。女士认为与其进口牛肉，还不如在国内养牛。男士回应说，这非常有道理。
exam_questions.explanation: 女士说：'why not raise cattle here?' 男士回应：'Makes perfect sense.'

exam_questions.question_text: What business does the woman say has a vast and continual market?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Technical equipment.", "B) Business consultancy.", "C) Beef.", "D) Car washing."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。男士告诉女士，他考虑的期末商业项目是洗车场。女士说，周围有很多汽车，而且这些车又不会很快消失，这是一个广阔且持续的市场。
exam_questions.explanation: 男士说：'I was thinking about a car wash...' 女士回应：'there's plenty of cars about and those aren't going away any time soon... You got yourself a vast and continual market.'

exam_questions.question_text: Who would the man's imagined business cater to?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Car owners of all walks of life.", "B) High-end customers in big cities.", "C) Consumers craving for professional service.", "D) Well-off dealers seeking a profitable markup."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。男士明确表示想让自己的商业项目更适合大城市中的高端消费者。
exam_questions.explanation: 男士说：'I was thinking of having it cater to high-end consumers in large cities.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from a new study about young children?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Parents' talking with them during TV time raises their curiosity levels.", "B) Their daily television exposure cuts parent-child conversation time.", "C) The more TV they watch the poorer their progress in development.", "D) Their socioeconomic levels impact their academic achievement."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。一项新的研究表明，在看电视时，父母与学龄前儿童对话越多，这些孩子在上幼儿园时好奇心水平就越高。
exam_questions.explanation: 研究显示：'the more parents engaged in conversation with preschoolers during TV time, the more likely those children were to have higher curiosity levels when they reached kindergarten.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did Prachi Shah's study specifically focus on?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Kids' enhanced learning.", "B) Kids' curiosity levels.", "C) Kids' reading and math.", "D) Kids' behavioral development."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。朴拉琪·沙阿的研究所关注的是儿童的好奇心水平。
exam_questions.explanation: 研究：'specifically focused on curiosity levels'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say about excessive media exposure?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It can hinder kids from getting on with their peers.", "B) It can cut into kids' time on exploratory activities.", "C) It can arouse kids' interest in how people interact in real life.", "D) It can widen the gap between kids from different economic statuses."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。过多接触电视等媒体可能会取代游戏和亲子互动等探索性活动，而这些活动被认为是培养孩子好奇心的关键。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'Excessive media exposure, including television, can displace exploratory activities such as play and parent-child interactions...'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the dark side of our inborn drive to acquire?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Exerting ourselves too hard in order to attain our life's goals.", "B) Being possessed with a single thought of professional success.", "C) Trying every means to beat others in terms of personal aspirations.", "D) Being mindlessly driven to possess more and more material things."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。据研究，我们每个人生来就有获取的欲望。这种获取的欲望的"黑暗面"是人类被无意识地驱使着想要拥有越来越多的"东西"。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章指出：'The "dark side" of this drive to acquire is being mindlessly driven to possess more and more "things"...'

exam_questions.question_text: What might happen if we do not harness our inborn drive to acquire?
exam_questions.options: ["A) We might isolate ourselves from our fellow beings.", "B) We might acquire an incorrect sense of well-being.", "C) We might end up pursuing all the wrong things.", "D) We might make a mess of our personal lives."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。如果不去有意识、深思熟虑地且有目的地控制这种与生俱来的获取欲望，我们可能就会在无意识状态下追求那些错误的东西。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'If you're not consciously, mindfully and intentionally harnessing this inborn drive to acquire, you might be mindlessly pursuing all the wrong things.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say about our intentional aspirational goals?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They should be based on solid theoretical concepts.", "B) They should take personal interests into account.", "C) They should include goals to help other people.", "D) They should increase our sense of worthiness."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。尽管在有意识的情况下所追求的目标包括获得那些能增加自己幸福感的东西，但这些目标也应该包括在自己的各种生命角色中去帮助他人。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章指出：'they ought to also include goals to help other people in your various life roles.'

exam_questions.question_text: What will you end up doing without pursuing intentional aspirational goals?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Drifting through life aimlessly.", "B) Giving up the chance to fulfill yourself.", "C) Abandoning all that life has to offer.", "D) Spoiling your character and integrity."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。如果没有想要追求的目标，你也就没有了奋斗的目标。如果没有了奋斗的目标，你就把自己置于随波逐流的危险境地。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'If you're not pursuing intentional aspirational goals, you have nothing to strive for... you're putting yourself in the dangerous position of simply drifting through life...'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker recommend in this talk?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Grade-raising ways and means.", "B) Pressure-alleviating exercise.", "C) Revision-conducting approaches.", "D) Brain-boosting food and drink."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲座开头提到，到了复习准备考试和论文的时间了。压力很大，所以你想要利用一切可以得到的辅助来帮助自己提高记忆力和成绩。接着，讲话者提到吃得好可以对你的复习计划产生真实的影响。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话者说：'eating well can make a real difference to your revision regime—so what brain-boosting food and drink would I recommend?'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker warn against about coffee?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Buying it from coffee shops.", "B) Building up a tolerance of it.", "C) Drinking it after 2 pm.", "D) Consuming it with sugar."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者明确指出，下午2点以后就不要再饮用咖啡了。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话者警告：'stop drinking coffee by 2 pm'

exam_questions.question_text: How can we get sufficient nutrients according to the speaker?
exam_questions.options: ["A) By taking varied vitamin supplements.", "B) By consuming a rich variety of foods.", "C) By eating both oranges and frozen berries.", "D) By getting components packaged in tablets."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者说，食物应该始终排在补充剂之前，获得尽可能多的营养的关键是吃各种不同颜色的食物。最好是从食物和饮品中获得你需要的一切。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话者建议：'food should always come before supplements and the key to getting as many nutrients as possible is to eat a varied diet...'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the worrying trend the late Swedish academic has identified?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Many people across advanced economies think the world is going from bad to worse.", "B) The news focuses on reporting catastrophes that occur across the world.", "C) A significant part of the world is experiencing another great recession.", "D) Many people have no idea of those living under miserable conditions."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节推断题。已故瑞典学者汉斯·罗斯林发现了一个令人担忧的趋势：发达经济体内许多人不仅不知道世界正在变得更好，他们还认为情况恰恰相反，即发达经济体内很多人都认为世界正变得越来越糟。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'not only do many people across advanced economies have no idea that the world is becoming a much better place, but they actually even think the opposite.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about globalization?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It has experienced ups and downs like any other historical trend.", "B) It is hailed as a miracle by both economists and ordinary people.", "C) It is the only way for all countries to share economic prosperity.", "D) It has given more and more countries a rare chance to thrive."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者说，全球化是确保所有国家共享经济繁荣的唯一出路，而不是只确保少数发达经济体的经济繁荣。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章指出：'globalization is the only way forward to ensure that economic prosperity is shared among all countries and not only a select few advanced economies.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about half of the global population?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Their fortunes may take a downturn.", "B) They can be classified as middle class.", "C) Their living standards have been deteriorating.", "D) They are experiencing a radical transformation."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。事实上，全球半数人口都可以被视为中产阶级，这是自工业革命以来的第一次。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'for the first time ever since the Industrial Revolution, about half of the global population can be considered middle class.'

exam_questions.question_text: What question does the speaker try to answer in this talk?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Why smells can activate emotional memories.", "B) How powerful the sense of smell can become.", "C) How scent particles revive memories forgotten.", "D) Why the scent of bread has a strong mental impact."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲座以面包的香味可以引发人们的久远记忆切入，引发了讲话者的问题——为什么气味有时会引发强烈的记忆，特别是情感记忆？之后，讲话者一直在试图回答这一问题。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话者问：'But why do smells sometimes trigger powerful memories, especially emotional ones?'

exam_questions.question_text: What is said to result in an intimate connection between emotions, memories and scents?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The brain cells' processing of memories experienced as strongly emotional.", "B) The activation of the brain's emotion processing area by chemical particles.", "C) The interaction between chemical particles and the brain cells responsible for smell.", "D) The sensations of scents going directly to the brain's emotional and memory centers."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。气味是唯一能直通大脑情感和记忆中心的感觉。它引发了情感、记忆和气味之间的密切联系。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章指出：'Scents are the only sensations that travel such a direct path to the emotional and memory centers of the brain.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the brain use to give meaning to information and find a memory?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Imagination.", "B) Association.", "C) Experience.", "D) Context."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。大脑是利用情境来赋予信息意义并找到记忆的。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章提到：'the brain uses the context to give meaning to the information and find that memory.'

exam_questions.question_text: What drawback do memories of scents share with other memories?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Inaccuracy and alterability.", "B) Susceptibility to polar interpretations.", "C) Being personal and individualistic.", "D) Being dependent on relevant scenarios."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。尽管气味带来的记忆具有特殊性，但它们与其他记忆有着相同的缺点。它们并不总是准确的，而且会随着时间的推移而变化。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章指出：'They aren't always accurate, and they can change over time.'

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格所在句的主语是negative energy,谓语动词是cast,空格处是宾语,前面有不定冠词a,据此可知空格处是一个名词。负能量对双方达成共识不会有好的影响,因此填入L) shadow"(坏)影响;阴影",cast a shadow over "给……蒙上阴影",比喻对事情产生负面影响。
exam_questions.explanation: 根据上下文，负能量会给建立共识的努力蒙上阴影。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格与smiles合在一起构成名词性短语,与appreciation,warm comments并列作介词via的宾语,据此推测空格处是一个形容词,修饰名词smiles。空格所在句提到借助一些手段来传递积极的信息有助于交流的成功,这些手段包括由衷的赞赏和热情的评论,与这两个名词短语属于同一语义场的词是A) affectionate"表示关爱的"。
exam_questions.explanation: affectionate smiles表示关切的微笑，有助于积极交流。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格所在句主语是the dialogue,缺少谓语动词,dialogue是单数,据此推测空格处应为动词的第三人称单数形式。能够表达这种转变的是F) flips,在这里的意思是"(话题、活动或意见)突然转换","flip from...to..."指"从一个话题转换为另一个话题"。
exam_questions.explanation: flips表示对话从合作突然转变为对抗。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格所在处是"come to + 名词"的结构,表示到达某种状态,空格前是形容词immediate,可知空格处是这个结构中的名词部分。空格前面半句提到对话的语气升温,愤怒爆发,对话将从合作走向对抗,可以想而知,这种从好到坏的转变也会给已经取得的进展带来不好的影响,因此填入G) halt"停止,暂停"。
exam_questions.explanation: come to an immediate halt表示立即停止。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格所在句的主干为partner tires of listening,不缺必要的语法成分,空格又在动词tires前面,可推测空格处是一个副词,修饰tires。根据前一句中的tends to "往往,具有某种倾向或特征"可知这里应填入副词N) typically"通常,一般,具有代表性地"。
exam_questions.explanation: typically表示通常、一般，沉默的一方通常会厌倦只听不说。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格处作系动词feel的表语,应是一个形容词。上一题提到双方不对称的对话中一直在听的一方感到恼火,本题描述的是负责说话的一方的感受,可想而知,在对话中说个不停就意味着需要不停输出信息给对方,H) overburdened"负担过重的"符合说话的一方的感受。
exam_questions.explanation: overburdened表示负担过重，说话者会感到负担过重。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格所在句主语为different rates of speech and levels of voice volume,宾语为symmetry,缺少谓语动词,空格前又有情态动词can,据此推测空格处是一个动词原形。语速和音量的不同会破坏对称性,因此填入D) erode "逐渐毁坏; 损害"。
exam_questions.explanation: erode表示侵蚀、破坏，不同的语速和音量会破坏对称性。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格处是系动词is的表语,前面又有副词more修饰,综合可知空处是一个形容词。空格所在句提到对话一方的意见可能更有影响力,然后用because引出原因,指出这与他们的表达方式有关,O) vigorous"果断的,精力充沛的",用在句中表示一方的表达方式更加果断有力,影响力自然也就更大。
exam_questions.explanation: vigorous表示有力的、精力充沛的，表达方式更有力的一方影响力更大。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格处的词与副词more合在一起修饰expressed,据此可推测空格处是一个副词。上一题提到表达果断有力的一方的观点更有影响力,本题说的是观点被忽略的一方的表达方式,与果断有力相反的表达方式是犹豫不决,因此填入M) tentatively"犹豫不定地,踌躇地"。
exam_questions.explanation: tentatively表示犹豫地、试探性地，表达犹豫的观点容易被忽略。

exam_questions.options: ["A) affectionate", "B) approximately", "C) elapses", "D) erode", "E) flattered", "F) flips", "G) halt", "H) overburdened", "I) predominates", "J) propagate", "K) scenario", "L) shadow", "M) tentatively", "N) typically", "O) vigorous"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。if引导的条件状语从句中的主语为either partner,空格处的词与后面的动词evaporates由or连接作为谓语,可知空格处也是一个第三人称单数形式的动词。空格所在句是对上文提到的对话中不对称,不平衡现象的总结,根据上文可知这种不对称表现为一方说得多,另一方说得少,evaporates"蒸发"可引申为"占次要地位,无足轻重",与之相对的是I) predominates "占主导地位"。
exam_questions.explanation: predominates表示占主导地位，如果任何一方始终占主导地位，对话就会失去平衡。

exam_questions.question_text: We cannot see the moon at times when it is positioned right between the earth and the sun.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。E段倒数第三句提到，在新月期间，我们看不见它，因为我们的卫星正好位于我们和太阳之间。题干中的cannot see the moon对应原文中的it's invisible，题干中的positioned与原文中的parked为同义词。
exam_questions.explanation: E段倒数第三句：'It's invisible to us during the new moon, because our satellite is parked right between us and the sun;'

exam_questions.question_text: Volcanic eruptions may cause the moon to assume a moody blue color.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。K段第三、四句提到，月亮确实可以呈现出忧郁的蓝色，但这只发生在大小合适的粒子分散在天空中时——但这与月亮的"蓝色"状态无关。火山喷发或火灾产生的巨大火山灰云可以做到这一点。
exam_questions.explanation: K段第三、四句：'A moon can indeed take on a moody blue color, but this only happens when particles of just the right size disperse through the sky... Big clouds of ash from volcanic eruptions or fires can do the trick,'

exam_questions.question_text: The moon will be closest to the earth when the supermoon occurs in February.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。G段最后一句提到，超级月亮实际上要到二月份出现时才会离我们最近。
exam_questions.explanation: G段最后一句：'the moon won't actually be at its closest for the year until February's supermoon,'

exam_questions.question_text: There is nothing unusual about the super blood wolf moon, which will bear no resemblance to a bloody wolf head.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。B段前两句提到，超级血狼月食并没有什么真正神秘或特别的地方，它也不会看起来像一个血淋淋的狼头一样出现在天空中。
exam_questions.explanation: B段前两句：'there is nothing truly mysterious or otherwise special about this moon, and it will not look like a bloody wolf head in the sky or anything wild like that.'

exam_questions.question_text: The moon will appear orange when the light reflecting from it travels through an atmosphere thicker than usual.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。H段提到，每当月亮升起或落下，抑或是整夜低垂在地平线上时，月亮看起来也可能会是橙色的——因为从月亮反射回来的光必须穿过更厚的大气层。
exam_questions.explanation: H段：'The moon can also look orange whenever it's rising or setting, or if it hangs low in the horizon all night --- the light bouncing off of it has to travel through a thicker atmosphere there,'

exam_questions.question_text: It is contrary to logic to claim the name of wolf moon originates from the cultures of American Indians.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。M段提到，许多网站会告诉你"狼月"是"美洲原住民"文化中一年第一个满月的传统名称，这是一件奇怪的事情。饥饿嚎叫的狼在一月份是如此普遍常见，以至于所有拥有不同文化、地理和语言的北美部落都自发地提出了同样的绰号，这种想法是不合理的。
exam_questions.explanation: M段：'The idea that hungry, howling wolves were such a universal constant in January that all of North America with its different cultures, geographies, and languages spontaneously came up with the same nickname is illogical.'

exam_questions.question_text: As the moon's orbit is not a hundred-percent circle, its distance from the earth changes.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。F段第一句告诉我们，月球与地球的距离并不总是完全相等的，因为它的公转轨道不是完美的圆形。
exam_questions.explanation: F段第一句：'The moon isn't always exactly the same distance from Earth, because its orbit isn't perfectly circular.'

exam_questions.question_text: A full moon in a given month or season gets a specific name in different cultures.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。N段第一句指出，许多文化都对特定月份或季节的满月有传统名称。
exam_questions.explanation: N段第一句：'Many cultures have traditional names for the full moon in a given month or season,'

exam_questions.question_text: There are likely lots of people who know absolutely nothing about why the moon appears to change its size regularly but act like they know.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。D段第二句提到，可能大街上有很多人会假装他们完全知道为什么天空中的那个东西似乎无规则变大变小，但其实他们完全不懂。
exam_questions.explanation: D段第二句：'There are probably loads of folks who walk around pretending they totally know why that thing in the sky seems to get bigger and smaller at regular intervals but who totally do not.'

exam_questions.question_text: When a full moon appears twice in the same month, it is nicknamed a blue moon.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。J段第二句指出，蓝月亮是一个昵称，指的是两个满月在同一个日历月出现。
exam_questions.explanation: J段第二句：'a blue moon is a nickname for when two full moons fall in the same calendar month,'

exam_questions.question_text: What has become of the rural areas nowadays?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are becoming somewhat deserted.", "B) They are being increasingly urbanised.", "C) They are closely-knit communities.", "D) They are haunted by conservatism."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。文章首段提到全球城市化加速之后，在段尾将话题转向农村，而第二段具体阐述农村的现状，该段最后一句分析指出，世界各地的农村居民正在迁出，使得城市更加拥挤，而农村则一片荒凉。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段最后一句：'Attracted by the improved economics of urban areas, country-dwellers across the world are moving out, contributing to the excessive crowdedness of densely populated cities, and leaving the countryside in desolation.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think of the rural lifestyle?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is unlikely to survive given the on-going changes.", "B) It is less energy-efficient compared to that in cities.", "C) It is highly dependent upon heavy automobiles.", "D) It is a choice more affluent people will endorse."]
exam_questions.analysis: 观点态度题。定位句指出，支持农村这种生活方式的选择是不负责任的，回溯前文此结论的论据，本段第三、四句指出，因农村大多是独立的建筑，需要使用更多的能源，其能源效率无法与城市相比，可知乡村生活方式能源效率低于城市。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段：'Rural dwellers also use more energy maintaining their mostly detached buildings. We may be piled up like boxes in the city, but this brings energy efficiency that the countryside cannot match.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think of rich urban residents buying a second home in the countryside?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is bound to mar the traditional rural life.", "B) It adversely impacts rural social stability.", "C) It hinders rural economies' revitalisation.", "D) It is detrimental to rural preservation."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。定位句提到一些在城里发了财的人经常在农村购置第二套房子，去体验所谓的简单生活，在随后的第三、四句自地点明这样做的影响是负面的，主要就在于推高房价，令当地人负担不起，迫使原本的农村居民迁出，可见对农村的保护是不利的。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段：'The side-effect of this is that house prices are pushed up due to increased demand, leaving them unaffordable for local people. A solution has yet to be found for this challenge, for market forces are further forcing residents out of the countryside.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the countryside with industrialisation and technological advances?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is destined to change gradually.", "B) It will present an idealised way of life.", "C) It is likely to embrace foreign cultures.", "D) It will become increasingly diversified."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。定位段第二至四句提到工业化和网络等现代技术对农村的影响，最后一句总结称，鉴于这些变化，农村的不断发展是不可避免的。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段最后一句：'Considering these changes, surely an evolving countryside is inevitable.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think of the future of the countryside compared with cities?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is going to be harder for the locals.", "B) It is going to resemble that of cities.", "C) It is less likely to stay static.", "D) It is less easy to envisage."]
exam_questions.analysis: 观点态度题。定位句指出，我们知道世界将见证新城市从尘埃中崛起，现有城市将发展成为特大城市，而农村的未来仍不明朗，可见与城市相比，农村的未来是人们不太容易想象的。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段：'we know that the world is going to see new cities emerging from the dust and current cities growing into megacities, but the future of the countryside is less clear.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say about the statement "beauty is in the eye of the beholder"?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It has hardly ever been disputed.", "B) It can be interpreted aesthetically.", "C) Many people have found it absurd.", "D) People have long been misled by it."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。文章首段第一句指出，诸如"美存在于观看者的眼中"之类的说法，鲜少遭到质疑。
exam_questions.explanation: 首段第一句：'Statements, like "beauty is in the eye of the beholder", are rarely questioned.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does a recent study exploring aesthetic taste show?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Aesthetic tastes tend to differ from person to person.", "B) Natural beauty is rarely surpassed by artificial beauty.", "C) There is less consensus on objects shaped by human craft.", "D) There is general agreement on what is pleasing to the eye."]
exam_questions.analysis: 事实细节题。文章第二段第一句指出，近期一项探讨审美品位的研究发表在《认知》杂志上。紧接着第二句提到该研究的结果表明，人们对自然物体的审美评价非常一致，但对人工制品或人造物体的审美评价分歧较大。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段：'The results from this study show that people agree very much in their aesthetic evaluation of natural objects, but they disagree more about artifacts, or human-made objects.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why do people differ in their aesthetic appraisal of artifacts?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They come out in a great variety of designs.", "B) They lead to varying behavioral consequences.", "C) They take up much less natural space than landscapes.", "D) They come into people's view less often than natural spaces."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章第五段第二句指出，人们对艺术和建筑的共同品位水平也不尽相同，由句首的so可知上一句解释了原因；与自然空间不同，艺术和建筑没有相同的曝光程度，也就是说原因是人工制品较少进入人们的视野。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段：'Art and architecture, unlike natural spaces, do not have the same level of exposure. So, people do not have the same level of shared taste.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the example of sunset tell about nature?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It creates a powerful appeal through its brilliant radiance.", "B) It displays aesthetic traits in a similar way the world over.", "C) It embodies beauty with a wide array of aesthetic features.", "D) It establishes the principles of beauty in a number of ways."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章第八段第一句提到，自然界在全世界以一种共同的方式展示了一些普遍的审美特征。紧接着第三句以日落为例进行说明：不同地方的日落极为相似，令其具备了近乎普遍的吸引力。
exam_questions.explanation: 第八段：'Nature exhibits some of the universal aesthetic features such as radiance in a common way throughout the world... For example, a sunset is similar enough in different places to warrant almost universal appeal.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why do artifacts not always hold universal appeal?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The appreciation of their beauty is not subject to objective standards.", "B) The universal principle of beauty prevents a wide array of embodiments.", "C) The way their creators apply the principle of beauty may not be pleasing to everybody.", "D) Their creators interpret the universal principle of beauty each in their preferred way."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章第九段第一句提到美可能存在的普遍原则属于一般类别，可以有各种各样的体现。紧接着第二句和第三句以人工制品为例进行说明，当人们参与建筑作品或艺术作品的制作时，他们会以独特的方式应用这些非常普遍的概念，然而他们应用这一原则的方式可能并不具有普遍的吸引力。
exam_questions.explanation: 第九段：'When people get involved in making artifacts in architecture or art, they apply these very general concepts in unique ways. But the way they applied the principle may not have universal appeal.'

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.correct_answer: Yangshan Port, a key part of the Shanghai Shipping Center, stands as China's first deep-water port and one of the largest deep-water ports in the world. After nearly two decades of development, the port has achieved a high degree of automation. The application of digital technology and artificial intelligence has greatly reduced labor costs as well as carbon emissions. The independently developed terminal management system can realize remote control of large equipment at a distance of over 100 kilometers. Although Yangshan Port appears to be bustling, there is actually no man operating on site. It can operate continuously around the clock. The port will continue to develop and make greater contributions to building Shanghai into a global shipping center.
exam_questions.analysis: 翻译题目，需要学生将中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法、词汇和句式结构的正确性
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的汉译英能力，包括词汇选择、语法结构、句式转换和语言表达的准确性
